subject: Re: [junit] Re: Parameter in JUnit!
msgSnippet: ... Just in case there is confusion, parameterized test cases have been used for years with JUnit 3. If you would like to do so, too, this list is often glad
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> Bottom line is: parameters are good and useful, and both JUnit 4 and
> TestNG support them (but not JUnit 3).

Just in case there is confusion, parameterized test cases have been used
for years with JUnit 3. If you would like to do so, too, this list is
often glad to support you.

David Saff
